title: Justification - Accum Func in Applied Context

content.question: Honey is poured through a funnel at a rate of <math alttext="r of t, equals, 4 times e raised to the negative 0.35 t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>0.35</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ounces per minute, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in minutes. How many ounces of honey are poured through the funnel from time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to time <math alttext="t equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts
